content.raw:
I think this and [the other](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/248/set-mass-matrix-using-cylinder-and/diff#comment-61570359) suggestion are very good ideas, but there's also nothing wrong with having these functions the way they are and then later on adding in overloads of the functions that accept an `ignition::math::Sphere` or `ignition::math::Cylinder` argument after we've had time to nail down those class concepts.

I still believe that adding in shape types to `ign-math` should be treated as a major design consideration (because of the sheer importance of a good geometry system), and we shouldn't rush into it casually.
content.html:
I think this and the other suggestion are very good ideas, but there's also nothing wrong with having these functions the way they are and then later on adding in overloads of the functions that accept an ignition::math::Sphere or ignition::math::Cylinder argument after we've had time to nail down those class concepts.

I still believe that adding in shape types to ign-math should be treated as a major design consideration (because of the sheer importance of a good geometry system), and we shouldn't rush into it casually.

content.raw: Just like commented on pull request #248, Consider adding a simple `ignition::math::Sphere` class as suggested on issue #90. For the purposes of this pull request, it could just have a radius member variable and corresponding setter/getters.
content.html: Just like commented on pull request #248, Consider adding a simple ignition::math::Sphere class as suggested on issue #90. For the purposes of this pull request, it could just have a radius member variable and corresponding setter/getters.
